input: A group trapped in a cave uses dynamite to blast a fat man stuck in the exit out of the way to save the group from drowning.
Gravediggers sell poisonous oil to customers specifically to cause deaths and increase the demand for graves.
A judge frames and executes one innocent person to prevent rioters from killing five hostages.
A doctor withholds a massive dose of a scarce drug from one patient who needs it all to save five others who need smaller doses.
A doctor kills one healthy person to use their organs to save several dying patients.
A person tortures one victim because a tyrant threatens to torture five others if they refuse.
A person kills one innocent victim because a mad murderer promises to kill two others if they refuse.
A hospital manufactures a life-saving gas for five patients foreseeing that the process releases lethal fumes that will kill another patient.
A doctor kills a child to save the mother when medical circumstances imply both will die unless the child is killed.
Shipwrecked survivors kill a child/companion to save the rest of the group from starvation (parallel to the Dudley and Stephens case).
A doctor crushes a child's skull during delivery to save the mother who would otherwise die.
A rescuer chooses to save a single person stranded on one rock rather than a larger group stranded on another.
